posts.author: HipMaestro
posts.content:
babaGAReeb wrote:I don't play a server, never have only play modules fanmade or original.
Then, in your request, state that fact up front. A level 40 build may not be the best for you unless you expect to reach that level. Many, if not most Level 40 builds are optimized AT Level 40 which are really builds that should be used on servers where you will be able to play it for a long time at Level 40. Some epic (Level 40) builds can be adopted for fewer final levels, but that is the exception more than the rule. The best is to design a build to match as close to the highest level you are likely to take that character. Some content is spread over a series so only the last chapter needs to be considered for target character level.

Usually, a module author will furnish beginning and ending character level targets. Using that, build a character that is as optimized as possible throughout the entire leveling.
babaGAReeb wrote:
the prob i got with magical master is it uses raipers and i dont like them cause thats not how you fight with a rapier! the animation for it is wrang are there other weapon alternatives?
The combat attack potential is DEX-based so needs to use a weapon that can be finessed (i.e. feat: Weapon Finesse). The weapon must be one size smaller than the race and be finesse-able. Those are dagger, handaxe, kama, kukri, light hammer, mace, rapier, shortsword, sickle, whip, and unarmed strike. Plus rapier (the exception) for medium races (small races must use it two-handed so cannot be finessed for halfling or gnome). The rapier and kukri (exotic) have the widest BASE crit range (18-20), followed by dagger & shortsword (19-20). All the others crit only on 20 (if my memory is having a good day).

Those are your choices in any DEX build. Any build that can self-buff extensively (like cleric) can gain a huge advantage by going the DEX route as long as there are no STR-based feats planned, like DevCrit for example.

I hope this helps, but include your preferred weapon in your request as well as the other important guidelines so that the guild membership doesn't need to suggest builds that you won't enjoy playing.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Just correcting a bit of wrong information you may have gotten. The Magical Master is built to use kamas, not rapiers. You start with a Rapier because it's the best finesseable weapon for one that doesn't dual-wield. That is for the first 15 levels. You can use a mace, or any of the other weapons mentioned by Hip, as long as they are adequate for Finesse. However, if you forego Kamas, you won't have Monk custom attack schedule, which is one of the strengths of the build.

Hip is right, though, about using a build that will suit the place you're playing. This particular build reaches its full potential quite close to the end, which means that if you play a mod that takes you from 1-20, you probably won't see it flourish. It's not gonna be weak, no Cleric/Monk is, but it's definitely not going to show its "true colors". You start getting some serious firepower after level 31, so you're going to be a bit disappointed if you finish a certain campaign around level 25.

Take it EZ!
